result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Shall maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs. 
Shall not have contact with Brian Schicker.
Shall not possess alcohol, controlled substance or drug paraphernalia including but not limited to syringes and vaping devices.

Shall successfully complete and discharge from probation on companion count.
Shall file monthly written report with the District Attorney's Office.

timeConds.notes: Shall complete 40 hours of uncompensated community service within 9 months.

miscConds.notes:
Shall maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs. 
Shall not possess or consume any controlled substance or paraphernalia, including syringes and vaping devices, without a valid prescription. 
Shall not possess any alcohol on person, in residence or occupied motor vehicle.

Court grants expungement upon notice from DOC that all Court ordered conditions have been completed prior to discharge, including 40 hours of community service and payment in full of any fine/costs and supervision fees.  Expungement will not be granted if supervision fees and/or court obligations are collected by DOR via the tax intercept program.

Any Assessments and Counseling as recommended by DOC. 
DNA Sample/Surcharge - no sample necessary if previously provided. 
ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS IN THIS CASE WILL BE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE CALUMET COUNTY CLERK OF COURT OFFICE AND NOT YOUR PROBATION AGENT.  If you are not able to pay in full within 60 days, please call 920-849-1414 and speak to the Account Clerk to establish a payment plan.  Probation Agent is responsible to monitor ongoing payments to make sure all obligations are paid as a part of probation conditions.
If financial obligations are not paid in full and you have not contacted the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days, a civil judgment shall be entered against you for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect this debt, including sending unpaid obligations to the State Debt Collection Agency.

timeConds.notes: Shall complete 40 hours of community service to be granted Expungement.
